Publisher's Website

Name: Seattle-opoly
Description:
How do you make a game about the Emerald City? While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Seattle we could into this box. It’s filled with music, art, sports, a big troll, uniqueness and...lots of rain! Looking for a fun way to experience the emerald city? Here it is!
 Here’s a quick idea of how to play... Buy your favorite seattle properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun!
 So choose your token and advance to rain! You may soon be the mayor of Seattle... or you may be stuck in one heckuva traffic jam!
 Get your game on! This is Seattle... and it’s your roll!

Publisher's Website

Name: St Louis-opoly
Description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏŒνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿–ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

This is a re-themed version of Monopoly sporting St Louis Landmarks.

Name: Het Vaarbewijs Spel
Description:
From the official website (translated from Dutch)
Visit the ports and win! 
In the game, up to six players on a star shaped board, try as first player to visit all six Dutch ports. this can be done over land or water. Along the way the players must answer questions and can save for a bigger ship or a permit. 
  
But that's not without a struggle. Players can encounter, severe turbulence, a license check by the water police, vehicle breakdown or they have to wait for an open bridge. After the purchase of a ship, all ports can be visited by water. The ports can also be visited overland, but that is dangerous because other players can tag you  on the ring dike. 
  
The player who first collects all the port tokens, wins the game

Explanation for non-Dutch visitors
In the Netherlands you must have a Sail License (Dutch: Vaarbewijs) if you want to sail a sailboat longer than 15 meter or a motorboat whose speed can exceed 20 km/h. 
There are two types of license.
With Sail License 1 you may sail the numerous rivers, canals and small lakes of the Netherlands
With Sail License 2 you may sail the big lakes, sea arms and inland seas.
To get such a license you have to take an official exam, which quizzes you on traffic rules, navigation, boat handling  and the dangers  on the water. This game tries to teach some of those rules.

Name: Sneak Attack
Description:
From the description of the game:
"When war comes, humans no longer man the battlefield. Wars are fought by mechs, giant robots, remotely controlled from far-away bases, with the riders of these giant mechs completely out of harms way.

Nonetheless, your commanding officers have a job for you. A job putting you in the line of real danger. Intel suggests that the enemy has amassed a large force, and put them ashore outside your capital in the midst of night. Their mission? To launch nuclear missiles at your nations leader, and every monument in your capital.

Our engineers have sent out a signal that interrupts the mech's connection with their home base, causing them to wander meanlessly around.

Now, you must sneak out to destroy each of the enemies' mechs, before they are powered up and ready to launch.But be careful."

Sneak Attack is a free, print-to-play game designed for the "sneaky sci-fi game contest".
During play, you will move around a hexagonal board depicting a battlefield. The player will attempt to sneak up on enemy mechs, destroying them with EMP charges, in order to save their home, and the pride of their country.

Name: Conquest of Arthenia
Description:
A efficiency engine/resource management collectible card game that is so similar to Magic: the Gathering that rather then providing a description of the game on it's own merits the pubslisher just lists how it's  different from other CCGs (i.e. Magic):

How is Conquest Different From Other CCGs?

1. Faster pace. With 2 resources acquired per term (most every other CCG is 1) plus the ability to barter 1 resource and acquire a third resource each term, every term is exciting and brings new twists into the fray. Never suffer through another, "Draw a land. My turn is over" term again.

2. Multi-region system. With 4 location regions per commander and a central battlefield region, you have far more options and therefore strategy is kicker. Like in a game of chess, in Conquest you need to think about positioning for your units. In most card games, it's simply your army vs. your opponent's army, 2 regions, and whether to attack or defend is a very simple matter of arithmetic.

3. Various strategies to pursue. Because locations and upgrades, commanders' sources of income, are vulnerable to attack and destruction, commanders have more options for how to seek a victory--a straight out offensive on the enemy domain to flat-out win or a more subtle wearing down of the opponent's income. Also, with 2 types of income (gold and mana), you can try to isolate one of these sources to cripple the opponent's army.

Name: Spider-Man
Description:
From the Publishers website:
When Peter Parker, bitten by radioactive spider, he received a spider's relative speed, force and movement. He became Spider-Man. 
Such amazing talents like to hang the web and climb the walls, he used to fight against crime.
Now Spider-Man is in danger of losing his power to his secret enemies. The radioactive spider has disappeared from his dark secret laboratory. 
Now all the Spider-Man disguised enemies are terrorizing the New York. They all are now more dangerous than ever, because now they hold the key to Spider-Mans power.
The only way to cope with precarious situation and restore order to New York is to find the radioactive spider and take it to security, a secret laboratory.
Your task is not easy, because all the players will try to find the missing spider. 
During the game you need to survive action events and traps, you also have to fight against other players. Who is the right and true Spider-Man? It will not become clear until the very end of the game. Right Spider-Man is the one who succeeds in bringing the radioactive spider back to the laboratory.

Content: Board
  1 dice
  1 Spider-Man spinner
  6 Spider-Man character (pawn)
  6 colored tripod pawns
  5 reels
  sticker sheet with 5 stickers
  50 cards (14 Syndicate Cards, 12 Surprise Cards, 24 Accessory Cards)

Name: Crazy Alias
Description:
There are many cards, each card has 6 words written on it. Each word has a number, from 1 to 6. Words are various - from very easy to very hard. Some are made of several words defining one thing (example: "Silver Medal"). There is also a board with tiles. Each tile is marked with number from 1 to 6.

So, players play 2 vs.2. Each team gets a figure representing it on the board. Their goal is to get through the board. Each time a figure stops one team member must take a card and not show it to other team member. After that a sand clock (also included) is set. The Player must get the other team member to say the word that is written on card by using sentences to describe the word. For example, if the word is "Silver Medal", a player can say "something that a sportsmen wins at the Olympic games". But if other team member says just "Medal", it isn't correct. Then the first player must further define what the hint might be. Second player can answer as often as he/she wants until the time runs out. If time runs out or first player accidentally uses the word which is written in card, the team looses a turn.

This Alias is weird and crazy. The words doesn't make any sense, but you still need to explain these. Can you do it?

Name: Genius Alias
Description:
There are many cards, each card has 6 words written on it. Each word has a number, from 1 to 6. Words are various - from very easy to very hard. Some are made of several words defining one thing (example: "Silver Medal"). There is also a board with tiles. Each tile is marked with number from 1 to 6.

So, players play 2 vs.2. Each team gets a figure representing it on the board. Their goal is to get through the board. Each time a figure stops one team member must take a card and not show it to other team member. After that a sand clock (also included) is set. The Player must get the other team member to say the word that is written on card by using sentences to describe the word. For example, if the word is "Silver Medal", a player can say "something that a sportsmen wins at the Olympic games". But if other team member says just "Medal", it isn't correct. Then the first player must further define what the hint might be. Second player can answer as often as he/she wants until the time runs out. If time runs out or first player accidentally uses the word which is written in card, the team looses a turn.

In this Genius Alias, you have word you have never heard. The are long, they are hard. Are you smart enough to play this game???

Name: Mad Robots
Description:
Mad Robots is the game of slightly crazed megalomaniac robots. These twisted geniuses have been building Doomsday Death-Ray Devices (DDD), and are now in the final stages of construction.
All that remains is to deploy Nano-Bots into the construction to activate the 6 final components, and then, victory is theirs!

Each player (Mad Robot Genius), has 6 Nano-Bots at his disposal. These Bots are deployed from the LAB starting point to venture out into the DDD structure in an attempt to locate and control the last 6 remaining components of the DDD.

Name: デジタルモンスタ Dejitaru Monsutā
Description:
Japanese CCG created by Bandai and based on the pocket digital pet and anime series of the same name. Known as Digimon in the US.

Players pit various monsters against eachother in battle, attempting to deplete the opponents of energy and striving to evolve their own monsters to more powerful forms by playing cards to enhance combat or advance the monsters through two or more stages.

Each monster is denoted by a leter and colour type that is referenced vs the opponents monster to determine one of three types of attacks that can be performed. Players attempt to outperform their opponent by playing enhancements to increase the power of the attack, evolve to a more potent form, or to even change the colour type to one more advantageous. Cards may also be played to weaken or devolve the opponent monsters.
The monster ending the battle with the highest rating wins.

Each starter contains 34 cards and one gold embossed card and one special "hologram" card. Rules and battlemat are combined in a single mapfold sheet.

The Upper Deck release of the Digimon game in 2000 appears to use slightly modified cards as this with similar rules.

Name: Assaut sur Suez: Opération Mousquetaire – Novembre 1956
Description:
Game published in Vae Victis 92.

Assaut sur Suez is a game covering the French and English attack on Suez during the operation Mousquetaire on 5th an d6th November 1956.

The game has a point to point map divided in 8 sectors (Gameel, Cimetiere, Port-sair, gold, Rasawa, Route Sud, Port-Fouad, Marias salants).
Each point connection represents 400m.
The game last for 6 operation steps representing 4h during the day or 12h at night. Each operation step can have from 1 to 8 turns.
Each counters represent a company (120 men) or equivalent.

The game has an historical scenario to be played solo and and variant to be played with 2 players.

Name: Cardgame Space Cruiser Yamato
Description:
Issue game of old Game Journal 48. Covers the whole story of the first TV series of Space Cruiser Yamato.

The basic mechanics is Mille Bornes.

The first player to go Iscandal and bring back Cosmo-cleaner to the Earth is the winner. If no player can bring back the Cosmo-cleaner within the determined number of decks, the earth would be lost.

1 timetrack
108 cards

Name: Roman Triumph
Description:
Covers the 7 main battles of 2nd Punic war: Ticcino, Trebia, Transimeno, Cannae, Becura, Metaurus, and Zama.

1 map with no terrain must be prepared.
192 counters are provided as sticker. These must stick to cardboard and cut.
2 charts.
6 sided die is needed

Issue game of old Game Journal 47.

Name: Omega War: Salvo 2064
Description:
Omega War: Salvo 2064 is a solitaire print-n-play game loosely based on the old pencil-n-paper game Salvo, with several new twists and the option for multi-player games.

You play the lone survivor of a global war battling against a mobile AI bunker intent on exterminating you with powerfull reflex beams capable of targeting locations on the other side of the planet. You are simmilarly armed and must pin down the AI and destroy it before it locates your last safe haven and finishes off the human race.

The game was designed to be blind accessible and may be found at the Starfield Games site.

Name: Powerrails
Description:
Powerrails is an 18xx game which uses no regional setting like other games of the series, but eleven small (A4-sized) mapboards with only a handful of hexes and a small set of special rules for each of them.

The players are seeking to make the most money by buying and selling stock certificates of up to eight railroad companies (depending on the scenario played). The player with the most stock of a particular company in his possession acts as the president of this company and is responsible for track laying, the placement of railheads (which are necessary for train runs), route selection and train acquisition. Running trains earns money and this money is either divided by the shareholders or kept in the company's treasure for further investments (like buying better trains or constructing track). This decision influences the value of the company's shares - and not the player with the most stock or the most beautiful constructed track wins the game, but the player with the most riches in terms of cash and shares.

The subtitle on the box is "Quickies for 1830 players". It uses mostly elements from 1830 and 1835, but introduces two new features: There is a ‘purple phase’ after the ‘grey phase’, and the ‘grey phase’ introduces city tiles with only one token space (tokens from the replaced brown tiles are all returned to their respective owning companies for future use).

All maps are playable in 2 to 4 hours, and most of them are especially tested for a 2-player game (in case of a 2-player game, the usual 60% holding limit in a company is lifted, if you buy additional shares from the bank pool).

Name: Peloponnes: Hellas Expansion
Description: The Hellas Expansion adds one more round (D) to the game, contains 3 landscapes and 3 buildings, 3 new civilizations and another 2 sea tiles.

Name: Hostile Stars
Description:
Hostile Stars is a tabletop miniatures wargame of tactical starship combat.  The game covers fleet scale battles with ships being grouped into squadrons led by flagships.  Players choose to allocate Reactor Points to perform movement and combat actions.  The movement system is based in 2 dimensions with some 3D considerations and the combat rules cover a variety of weapon types.  There are additional rules governing how ships are affected by the gravity and atmosphere of nearby planets.

Hostile Stars is designed for use with Dark Realm Miniatures but may be used with any starship minis.

The rules, ship stats, and player aids may be downloaded for free from The Dark Realm Miniatures website.

Name: 5150: First Contact
Description:
From publisher's website:

First Contact is a supplement to 5150, the original set of sci-fi rules from Two Hour Wargames. First Contact revolves around a rebellion on a small planet where the colonists have decided to break away from their home world. It documents the war between Earth and her first colony, Mars. 
But what starts out as a local conflict erupts into something larger as the rebels, known as the Sahadeen, receive help from an unexpected source, the ever-expanding empire of Gaea Prime.

First Contact incorporates the Earth Force and Sahadeen into 5150. We've documented the three stages of the conflict and have provided six linked scenarios into a mini-campaign. First Contact can be played solo against the game mechanics (or against the machine as we like to call it), cooperatively where all players are on the same side against the machine or competitively against your friends. And it can be played from either side.
Ideal for use with the 15mm range of Sci Fi figures from Rebel Minis, First Contact can be used with any figures you may already have.

5150: First Contact is not a stand alone game. You must have 5150 to play.

Name: Colonial Lemuria: New Worlds To Conquer
Description:
From the publishers website

Colonial Lemuria: New Worlds To Conquer is a source book that provides you with a complete continent to explore with both Colonial Adventures and Larger Than Life. But it's also our first step into the world of Victorian Science Fiction.

Lemuria - land of adventure. Old when Eden was young, it is a land of secrets both ancient and new. It beckons travelers, both experienced and new. Lost civilizations, exotic people, and strange steam driven machines open the door to a world of wonder.

Lemuria - where the established European powers of Colonial Adventure will vie with ancient peoples for control of the land and its people. To bring their bustling markets, mines, and gems under their control. Fight fierce desert warriors. Travel from steaming jungles to freezing mountains and beyond in search of great wealth.

Inside you'll find 
-Ten new army lists for Colonial Adventures. 
-Sixteen new types of unique to Lemuria animals to hunt.
-A detailed map with over 25 exotic cities that will be the scene for future Larger Than Life adventures.

Name: Cyber Sneak
Description:
Set in the far future, where the innocent are arrested for mere thoughts, one man is making a break for freedom. Players take control of the innocent man and his hacker friend and work together to outfox the automated prison guards and weapon systems.

A single board represents both the physical jail and the equivalent cyber world. As the heros move around the board they collect information in the form of cards that can be played to disable the jails defences, thereby making it easier to reach the goal

As well as fixed on-board obstructions the player has to avoid or deal with game controlled robots that move and patrol the jail.

Name: Definitions
Description:
A party word game. Contents:
Over 1200 Definition cards
1 Board
26 Alpha-pieces
4 blank pieces
Good Word Cards
Bad Word Cards

Descriptions from the box and rules:
"Word for word, we think you'll find DEFINITIONS(TM) more fun than any other pursuit." 
"An adult word game for 2 or more players."

Players attempt to move to the Dictionary space on a square board by correctly answering Definition questions. Each card has a word and three possible definitions, only one of which is correct. Along the way, players can send each other back to the Primer, collect Good and Bad word cards, and Challenge other player's definitions.

Name: Flames of War: Mid-War Monsters 1942-1943
Description:
From the book back:

This is a supplement for Flames of War the World War II Miniatures Game.

Massive 100-ton super tanks, nearly impenetrable light tanks, incredibly powerful tank-hunters, heavy armoured cars, and vastly improved medium tanks.

Mid-war Monsters allows you and your friends to try out some of the scientists' more interesting and outlandish creations on the Flames of War battlefield...

Name: Mission Patrol
Description: Mission Patrol is a game that is played with card tiles that you withdraw and roll dice to determine your fate. Your mission to find the detonator & charger in the jungle of Kimono island and destroy the man eating infested monsters island. The timer's ticking so hurry and reach for the chopper and escape to win the game. This game is designed to be played by 1 player. Good Luck Lieutenant Gimp.

Name: Adventures in the Lost Lands
Description:
Adventures in the Lost Lands is a tabletop miniature wargame based on the Two-Hour Wargames' Chain Reaction system.  It provides rules for gaming with dinosaurs, mammalian mega-fauna, and other prehistoric creatures in a variety of eras and settings.
 From the website:

Adventures in the Lost Lands introduces you to a world like no other, a world of giant creatures and prehistoric men where you can:

-Be a Pulp Era hero exploring lost lands and searching for valuable treasure
-Lead your tribe of primitive cavemen in a fight against other primitive tribes
-Be a modern-day big game hunter who travels to a prehistoric land that Time forgot
-Command a Victorian-era expedition bent on discovery and conquest
-Be a dinosaur (not only a dinosaur, but THE dinosaur), as you take on all others for supremacy
-Or maybe command a squad of WW 2 GIs hurled into a strange prehistoric world while on maneuvers in Louisiana (it's a long story....)

In Adventures in the Lost Lands, you can do all of this and more. We've included a number of linked scenarios forming a campaign that can be played solo, cooperatively with all players on the same side, or head-to-head against your friends. It's all up to you!

Adventures in the Lost Lands is a stand-alone game that can also be used with Larger Than Life and other Two-Hour Wargames rules.

Name: Gra Rycerska: Bitwa pod Grunwaldem
Description:
Gra Rycerska: Bitwa pod Grunwaldem (Chivalry Game: Battle of Grunwald) is a simple family game designed to describe (in a very simplified way) one of the largest battles in Medieval Europe The Battle of Grunwald or 1st Battle of Tannenberg.

One of the players takes on the role of WÅ‚adysÅ‚aw JagieÅ‚Å‚o (king of alliance of Poland and the Grand Duchy of Lithuania) while the other one commands Teutonic Knights forces as Ulrich von Jungingen. Each of the player forces consist of several formation of different unit types such as foot men, knights and archers.

On his or her turn player spins a spinner that determines one of his or hers formation. Then the player chooses one of the units belonging to this formation and can move and/or attack with it. Each unit type has specific movement and attack rules. First player to eliminate set number of enemy units is declared the winner.

Game was designed so it could be used as an introduction to abstract strategy games and to war games.

UPDATE: At the end of production process the name of the game was shortened to Bitwa pod Grunwaldem.

Name: Bloodlines
Description:
Description from the rulebook

Bloodlines is a game that can be played by 2-6 players. Each player controls one bloodline, which is represented by a set of nobles from the same family tree. Each living noble has one or two genetic markers, indicating which (up to two) bloodlines he or she belongs to. The genetic markers appear as tokens on the noble’s card.
The game proceeds in turns, and in each turn, the player can perform a set of actions with one or more of the nobles in his bloodline (nobles containing at least one marker for the players bloodline). Actions include having a baby, getting married, starting an affair, or challenging another noble to a duel.
Your goal is to use your actions wisely to build the most powerful bloodline in the game.

Name: Allez Saute!
Description:
Allez saute is a dexterity game made for kids. Each gamer plays a plane and a skydiver, the aim is to let the skydiver fall the closest of a target. The player moves its skydiver after a dice roll and choose when it has to fall. Or the others players can make you fall far from the target... It's working with a magnetic system.

You can choose to play sport or military skidiving.

Name: Hell on Wheels: a Warpspawn card game
Description: A Warpspawn game simulating the emergence - and rapid disappearance - of "vice towns" as the Union Pacific Railroad was laying down tracks in the 1860's to link the east and west coasts of the USA.  Each of 2-6 players bids to become RR Supervisor, who controls the order of activities in that turn, then spends their filthy lucre to build civilized establishments (schools, post offices) that bring in tax money and "other" establishments (saloons, gambling halls) that bring in more filthy lucre if they have lots of customers and mayhem. The game was just made available by Lloyd Krassner's Warpspawn Games, rules available on the Warpspawn website and e-group.

Name: Brennan's ExBEARdition
Description:
Based on part of the Brennan Bear Series games and books.
 Brennan's ExBEARdition is designed to help your student's listening skills grow through thinking and discussion.  Students will have fun as they practice listening skills in basic concepts, vocabulary, and language.

Players will answer questions, roll the die, and move along the game board to collect 4 different souvenir picture cards- one from each of the Brennan's destinations (Kool Kat's, Tiffany's, Tweet's, and the Milky Way). The first student or team to collect the 4 different souvenir picture cards wins the game.

Each Stimulus card contains questions for the young and advanced.  Questions are based on- basic concepts, vocabulary, and language- with 15 listening cards for an All Play activity.

Name: Fancy Nancy Positively Perfect Parfait Game
Description:
Fancy Nancy themed game. Players take turns Spinning the spinner to collect at least three different flavors of ice cream in their dish then top it off with a cherry. The spinner has the 4 different ice cream flavors spots, two cherry spots, an Oops! spot, and a Switch a Scoop spot. 
Players begin with an empty dish. Play begins with the person wearing pink hearts or the youngest. The player spins the spinner, if it lands on a flavor they do not have they get to put that flavor on their dish, if they already have that flavor, play goes to next player, an Oops! the player must put an ice cream back, a Switch a Scoop lets the player switch a scoop with another player, a cherry lets the player pick a flavor they wish or to put a cherry on their dish if they have 3 different ice cream flavors. The goal is to be the first to have a complete parfait.
Recommended for 2-4 players age 4 and up.
Helps teach turn taking, color recognition and very simple strategy to block another player with the Switch a Scoop. No reading is needed.
Contents:
Spinner
20 scoops of ice cream (cardboard)
4 cherries (cardboard)
4 fancy parfait dishes (cardboard)
1 play mat
-user submitted

Name: Dimension X
Description:
Chess in the Twilight Zone. From the introduction:

"This game consists of two parallel planes of existence. On one plane we have a typical chessboard; on the other plane (Dimension X) we have a board inhabited by strange trans-dimensional chess pieces in the form of snakes, spiders and crabs.  These creatures can leave Dimension X, and also return
to it..."

The rules of the game are simple. The goal is to checkmate your opponent's king. You start with 2 chess boards next to each other. On one board, you play a normal chess game, making 1 move per turn. On the other board each player has 3 short range pieces - creatures with strange powers - that may only move in Dimension X and only attack in our dimension. Each player, during his or her turn, also either moves one of the Dimension X creatures on the second board, crosses between dimensions, or attacks with a creature in our dimension.

This is a most unusual 3D chess variant that quite literally adds a whole other level of tactics and strategy to chess, with a twist.

Name: Pizza to Go: The Pizza Pickin' Card Game
Description: User summary: In each round of this card game, players simultaneously try to collect a set of four matching pizza-topping cards. Players start with four cards in their hand. The dealer takes a new card and discards any unwanted card from his hand to the player to his or her left. That player then discards to the left and play continues (the dealer continuing to pick up and discard) with the last player forming a discard pile in front of them. When a player collects a set of four, that player grabs a pizza box from the center of the table. There is always one fewer pizza boxes than there are players, so each round eliminates one player. Last player standing wins.

Name: Robin Hood
Description:
1970 Robin Hood boardgame by Editrice Giochi. The game included a 3d representation of the Sherwood Forest, along with a part of the Nottingham castle.

Players have to actually shoot the Nottingham Sheriff figure which walks through the forest. Four small firing crossbows are included in the game.

The game was marketed by Editrice Giochi as a "3Dimensional Game", because of the Sherwood forest setting which has actually to be built before playing.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood

Name: Peter the Great: Warpspawn card game
Description: Players bid on cards representing various events during the reign of Peter the Great.  Successful bids capture cards which generate victory points symbolizing accomplishments in the modernization of Imperial Russia.  Cards with Peter himself don't generate victory points, but rather grant advantageous contingencies.  There are 10 cards in each of 7 suites, unlike most Warpspawn card games there aren't different "force" or "power" levels for different cards.  The bidding requires different colored cubes picked at random, a unique mechanism in which high bid is most-cubes-of-that-color rather than most-play-money.

Name: Keep Safe In Traffic
Description:
"The game of playing it safe... while walking, bicycling, and driving."

Teaches children to use their eyes before their feet as they move tokens around a street grid. The crossing guard tokens helps the children and the game also teaches kids to avoid talking to strangers.

Situations include crossing at a traffic light, dialing 911, and hitchhiking.

Includes a colorful board with a spinner, kid tokens, car tokens, rules, and a sheet of reflective stickers for children to put on their bikes.

Cardinal Item No. 7000

Name: Super Scooper: The Ice Cream Collectin' Card Game
Description: User Summary: Very simple pattern game in which players must lay out non-matching scoops-of-ice-cream cards above a cone. Players start with four scoops in hand, a spinner determines how many scoops can be played out of the players hand, players draw back up to four, and play passes to the left. The “melt” position on the spinner requires a player to return an already played scoop, and “steal a scoop” cards let players steal scoops from others. The first player to get five non-matching scoops played on their cone wins.

Name: Election City U.S.A.
Description:
User summary: When more than three play, the players form teams.

Each card represents a number of electoral votes. To win the card (and get the votes) a player must roll the number on the card on either die or total of both dice. A player who gets the plurality of votes in a state wins the entire state. The player (or team) that gets the plurality of electoral votes has won the game.

Name: Colonial Battlefleet: Core Rules
Description:
Colonial Battlefleet is a game of tactical starship combat.

Take control of a task force of starships from your colony world and lead your fleet to victory or die a horrible death in the cold vacuum of space! Anything from a stealth destroyer to a mighty battleship is yours to command.

Colonial Battlefleet features easy to learn rules and exciting game play with minimal time spent waiting between turns. Shooting and damage resolution is easy and yields plenty of carnage. Best of all, Colonial Battlefleet is not a "luck of the dice" game. Although the rules are very straightforward, the game offers tremendous tactical depth and your command skills will be put to the test! There are no cumbersome or complicated systems to slow down play. All your attention will be focused on outmaneuvering and outwitting your opponent - not trying to remember rules.

The core rules come with a rich background which includes three playable factions. In addition, rules for creating your own factions are provided, and the system will support starship combat from any sci-fi setting. Technology trees allow you to easily tweak the rules to match the style of starship combat from your favorite books, movies, or TV shows.

Features of Colonial Battlefleet include:

-Fast and simple movement, shooting, and damage resolution
-Balanced fighter rules with minimal bookkeeping
-Adaptability to any sci-fi setting
-A robust yet easy to use starship construction system
-More than thirty unique weapons, defenses, and special equipment to outfit your ships
-Eighty hull sizes grouped into five categories from destroyer through battleship for maximum flexibility in creating your own designs
-Ten starship roles like 'Flagship', 'Battleline', or 'Screen' that define each ship's purpose and gives them bonuses that are relevant to that mission.
-Six technology trees for customizing races
-Optional rules for boarding actions, black holes, planets, warp storms, relatavistic distortion, the dangers of simultaneous warp point transit, and more!
-Full color double-sided counter sheets for missiles, asteroids, mines, warp points, planets, black holes, grape shot, and strategic bombardment rounds

The game is available as a PDF download.

Customers with Excel can take advantage of the point-and-click starship construction tool that is included with the files.  You can even save your classes and print off entire fleets in mere minutes.

Name: Sneaky Space Spinners
Description:
Humanity has made the jump to the stars only to find that they are not alone.  We are threatened by pirates, aliens and danger at every turn.  Our only hope is to send 2-4 intrepid heroes into the unknown to find new technology that might turn the tide in earth's favor.

Players take on the role of Earth's last hope, charting the galaxy, discovering new worlds and making a profit on the side. Keep an eye out for the four mysterious alien races: The Heartiols, The Diamondias, The Clubstations and The Spadoo. These fantastic beings have harnessed the power to 'spin' their region of space and will impart that power to you, for a price.  With this power, the Human race can effectively turn away any invader that might threaten the Earth.  Only a hero with all four space spinning artifacts can save us!

Playable with 4 space tiles, player ship tracking boards some tokens and a deck of standard playing cards!

Name: NUTS! The Big Hurt
Description:
NUTS! The Big Hurt is an expansion to the NUTS! World War 2 tabletop miniatures wargame.  From the publishers website:

The Hürtgen Forest was the site of America's most costly European battle of World War Two. Within its fifty square miles the US suffered more casualties than anywhere else. The Hürtgen Forest was a densely packed hell of tree-bursting artillery and machinegun fire. It was a trap where the infantrymen of the Allied First Army fool heartedly walked into. Virtually unsupported by armor and artillery, the numerically superior American forces would dash themselves against the hardened defenses of Hitler’s West Wall.

The Big Hurt is a supplement for NUTS! - 2nd Edition. Although intended to be played from the American side, The Big Hurt play's just as well from the German side. The Big Hurt can be played solo, cooperatively with all players on the same side or head-to-head.
Packed with 21 linked scenarios, this book covers a variety of small-unit and medium sized actions through the four months of the Hürtgen meat grinder.
Track down German infiltrators. Raid an enemy outpost. Capture a dam. It’s all up to you.

Name: Monopoly: Hello Kitty Collector's Edition
Description:
From USAopoly.com:

Hello Kitty brings a sweet style to America’s favorite board game in this special Collector’s Edition of the MONOPOLY game. Enter Hello Kitty’s world as you buy, sell and trade locations in her hometown of London such as the Bakery, the Music Theatre, the School Library, Playground and more. A must-have for Hello Kitty fans of all ages.

Six collectible tokens include favorite Hello Kitty items such as her Bow, Three Apples, Milk Bottle, Lunchbox, Fish Bowl and Teddy.

Name: Monopoly: The Office Collector's Edition
Description:
From USAopoly.com:

Buy, sell and trade your way to victory. Visit Schrute Farms and spend a night in the cozy "closet room". Get into the scent aroma market by acquiring Serenity by Jan. If you like "cable readiness" and paper thin walls, then be sure to invest in Michael’s condo.

Make deals and trades while building your corporate empire. Stay sharp because there is only room for one at the top. . . that’s what she said.

Game comes complete with six unique collectible tokens chosen by fans featuring - Dwight bobblehead, Pam’s candy dish, Beet, Unicorn princess, World’s Best Boss coffee mug and Bacon grill.

Name: Monopoly: John Wayne Collector's Edition
Description:
From USAopoly.com:

Saddle up for an adventure with the Duke!

Celebrate the life and career of one of the most beloved actors of our time, John Wayne. Known best for his roles as a cowboy, he also was a great athlete, rancher and outdoorsman representing the adventurous spirit of America.

As you attempt to bankrupt your opponents by buying, selling and trading the most significant properties in John Wayne’s life, kindly heed these words:

"You can take everything a man has as long as you leave him his dignity." -- John Wayne

Includes six collectible tokens: Cowboy Hat, Belt Buckle, Cowboy Boot, "Duke" the dog, John Wayne’s Director's Chair and Stagecoach.

Name: Monopoly: Major League Baseball Collector's Edition
Description:
From USAopoly.com:

Batter up!

What fan hasn’t dreamed of owning and running a Major League Baseball team? Now you can buy, sell and trade all 30 American League and National League teams in a quest to own them all. Major League Baseball and the MONOPOLY game have teamed up to put an exciting new spin on America’s favorite board game. Put on your game face and get ready to wheel and deal!
Includes six collectible tokens: Batter, Catcher’s Mask, Ball in Glove, Hot Dog, Pitcher and World Series Trophy.

Name: Crystal Formation
Description:
Crystal Formation is an Icehouse game for 2-4 players played on a chessboard.
Each player is given all of one color pieces and starts with a tree of their color in their corner of the board.The piece represents a node.
During your turn,you may perform one of the following actions:
1.Place new nodes.
2.Increase the total power of a node.
3.Move a node.
First player with 5 trees on the board wins.

Name: Ice 3
Description:
Ice 3 is an Icehouse game played on a chessboard.
Dump the Icehouse pieces out and arrange them as randomly on a chessboard as you can.Leave the center four spaces empty.
During your turn,you may move all pieces of either a color or a size any number of spaces in any one direction.
The object of the game is to get all of one color in any corner.

Name: Am laufenden Band
Description: Based on the popular German TV series "Am laufenden Band", the boardgame version is fun for all in the family. Every player maneuvers his playing piece across a conveyor belt, aiming for the highest scoring playing fields. The players push their luck and have to jump off the conveyor belt at right time. Content: 1 playing board, 24 playing pieces, 1 dice, 1 rulebook.

Name: Gackerei ums Hühnerei
Description:
Gackerei ums Hühnerei is a easy fun game for children. Players are sitting on  5 "egg" cards, which are placed top down on their chair. A dice is rolled and shows if a red, yellow or blue biddy should be hatched. Simutaniously all players uncover their eggs to find the right biddy and place it in the nest. 
The fastest player gets his egg as a VP and takes abother egg to place on it his chair.
But there can also be a fox around. So be aware...

Die Spieler legen jeweils fünf Eier-Karten verdeckt auf ihren Stuhl, setzen sich drauf und brüten! Der Würfel zeigt an, ob ein rotes, gelbes oder blaues Küken ausgebrütet werden soll. Jetzt ist Reaktion gefragt! Die Kinder schauen schnell nacheinander unter ihre Eier, ob sich ein solches Küken dort verbirgt. Hat ein Spieler ein passendes Küken gefunden, legt er es rasch ins Nest auf den Tisch, hält seine Hand darüber und gackert laut. Aber aufgepasst! Deckt ein Spieler einen Fuchs auf und legt ihn ins Nest, dann ruft er laut: Vorsicht, Fuchs! Alle Spieler müssen möglichst schnell ihre Hand auf das Nest legen. Wer am langsamsten ist, muss ein Ei abgeben.
 [www.kosmos.de]

Name: Escape From Sneakius IV
Description:
Introduction

You drew the short straw on Space Ranger duty today - your Federation of Planets scout ship was assigned to Sneakius IV, the most dangerous planet in the entire universe.  And in keeping with your luck, your ship encountered a mysterious space storm and crashed!

Sneakius IV is crammed full of every kind of lethal predator and deadly parasite that you could imagine... and you'll have to use your imagination because no survey team has ever survived the onslaught of ravenous beasties to file a report.  Your only hope is to try to make it across unknown terrain past horrible monsters to an escape shuttle at the abandoned ecology survey station.  But if you're caught on the way, you'll end up as lunch.  So, tread carefully Space Ranger... and pray you don't taste too delicious.

Gameplay Abstract

Players take on the role of characters moving from a crash site location to an abandoned ecology station using point to point movement.  The first player to reach the ecology station is the winner.  As players move their pawns through locations, they must roll a die to avoid detection by alien monsters represented by tokens.  If detected, they must fight.  Individual players use characters with individual strengths and weaknesses and player powers, helping them avoid or defeat monsters.  Each round, events on cards cause more monsters to spawn and regulate monster movement around the game board.

Additional Information

This game is an entry to the contest Sneaky Sci Fi Game Design Contest.

Name: Schleichfahrt: Sneaking Behind Enemy Lines
Description:
In the not so distant future, mankind has managed to lay waste to earth's surface. Even though forced to find a new home on the ocean ground, nothing stopped humans to continue battling each other.
You are a mercenary trying to make his living by serving those that pay most.
Your mission sounds easy at first glance:
Scout the ocean ground for three different resources and bring them back to the hangar, so the technicans can build a bomb you are to drop over the enemy base.
Here comes the downside: You are all on your own between the beasts of the deep sea as well as the very well armed hostile submarines.
And the resources to equip your sub are limited!
Good luck, mercenary - we count on you.

Schleichfahrt - sneaking behind enemy lines has been created during the Sneaky Sci Fi Game Contest in May/June 2010 held by Rudolf Aligierski. 
It is a solitaire ocean crawl in which you are playing a mercenary in his sub on his mission to gather resources and - upon having done so - to deploy a bomb on the hostile base.
While you will encounter monsters of the deep sea as well as loads of hostile subs, fighting is not always an option. Most of the time you will be better off relying on your engines to maneuver you out of sight of the enemy subs.

Name: Little Milkman
Description:
From the flyer: "Children love to play this familiar 'make believe milkman or milkmaid' game. they can make their own deliveries and collections or even run their own dairy business."

The game components are beautifully crafted. Six wooden enameled milk bottles fit neatly inside of the sturdy steel wire carrier container or a red wooden carrier in later editions.

The game was first published in the late 1930's.
Families: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG

Name: Cage
Description:
Cage is a finite, omnidirectional Checkers variant.  The 10x10 board is initially set up as shown in the figure.  The checkers jump orthogonally in any direction, and the direction can change during multiple jumps.

Cage is a game of annihilation.  The game must end, and when it does, there will remain at most one color of checkers on the board, guaranteed.  One unique feature of Cage is that you can jump off the board, removing both the capturing and captured checkers.

Name: Ace Raiders/Dead Sneakers
Description:
(From game rulebook)
In Ace Raiders/Dead Sneakers, each player acts as a team leader in charge of a six-man raiding team.  Each night, the players attempt to out perform each other by sending their raid teams into the nearby Robot outpost to recover alien weapons and technology.  Whoever recovers the most valuable tech is named ace raider for the night and earns promotion points.  The players have ten nights to gather as much as they can and get promoted ahead of their peers.  Because in ten nights, all of those recovered Robot weapons will be used in the first organized offensive since the invasion ended.  The highest ranking team leader will earn his place in history as the hero who established the foothold mankind needed in finally overthrowing the brutal reign of the alien invaders.

Ace Raiders/Dead Sneakers is an entry in the Sneaky Sci Fi Game Design Contest - WIN GG.

Name: Fransche Koningen Spel
Description:
French Kings Game

Oblong pennyprint with/of a board game, that is similar to the Game of Goose. There are 63 spaces, which depict kings and emperors of France from the year 420 to 1859, and eagles. In the middle is a larger picture of the 'Famille Impériale' (Emperor Napoleon III, emperor from 1852-1870, with wife and son). Title and Rules of the Game are in Dutch, the text with the pictures is in French. In the four corners there are pictures of acts of war with the subscripts 'En Afrique'; 'En Crimée'; 'En Italie'; 'En Chine.

Rule of the game

This game is played with two dice and goes from 1 to 63. Everyone throws [the dice] in turn, and puts something on the place that his number of pips indicates, with the second throw you move the number of spaces indicated by the number of pips in the throw, etc.

Whoever lands on number 63, the imperial family, wins the game and gets the pot. Before the start of the game, everyone agrees on an amount to put in the pot, and what the fines will be that have to be payed at every 'hinderpaal' (obstacle) or 'ontmoeting' (encounter) that either hinders progress or makes you change places, for example, if you throw 6, you pay a fine and go to 12.
If you land on 19, you are resting in the hotel, you pay the fine that was predetermined and you have to pass for 1 turn.
If you land on 31, where St.Louis is taken prisoner of war, you pay the fine and have to stay in the space until someone else is taken in your place.
If you land on 42, you are in the imperial garden, you pay the fine and go back to 39 (it may say 30, I can't tell).
If you land on 52, where the iron mask is in prison, you have to pay [the fine] and stay there until you are released again.
If you land on 58, Napoleon II at Solferino, you have to pay [the fine] and start from the beginning (written is '= 24 june 1859').
Whoever is passed by another player, has to pay and go to that players number.
Whoever throws a 6 and 3 at the start of the game, goes to 26 the trophee, and whoever throws 5 and 4, goes to 53, the crown (not sure if I see the numbers right).

If you land on an eagle, you go forward again the number of pips you threw on the dice (this will happen again if you land on another eagle). If you would pass 63 this way, you count back so many spaces as you have movement left over.

Name: All Things Zombie: Giving Up The Goat
Description:
All Things Zombie: Giving Up The Goat is an expansion for All Things Zombie tabletop miniatures wargame.

From the publisher's website:
Sometimes zombies are the least of your worries!
Two members of your group went downriver by boat in search of supplies. They were expected back before nightfall but it's been three days since they left.

Julie and Phil have only been with your little group of survivors for a short time. Maybe it was a mistake to let them go by themselves but sometimes that's the way things go. Since the zed outbreak it's better to look out for yourself.

But that still doesn’t make you feel any better. You asked for volunteers and two others will go with you. You just hope for their sake that Julie and Phil didn’t go all the way down to Lake Havasu. Not with the rumors about things worse than zombies prowling the countryside.

In Giving Up The Goat you will find...
-Rules for using Enemy Forces or PEFs 
-Rules for boats and swimming. 
-Rules for Chupacabra, Feral Dogs, Javelinas, and Rattlesnakes. 
-Rules for sleep deprivation.

Name: 1852: Ferrovias na Bahia
Description:
An 18xx game in the first state of Brazil, namely Bahia (BA).

Main characteristics:

Existence of 9 privates railways companies and 1 state-owned company;
Cost for construction of trails;
State incentives for building trails in part of the map;
Possibility of issue shares by railways companies;
Possibility of obtaining loans by railways companies;
Possibility of entry of state-owned company in the game.

Summary of privately held companies:

Grant-court registries - which prevents railways companies from other players build tracks in a round of operations;
Water and sanitation company - turns a town into city;
Contract for sale of agricultural products from other states - adds financial value of the routes that connect certain cities off map to the port cities;
Fundraising for the Estrada de Ferro Bahia ao São Francisco (Railway Bahia to San Francisco) - gives an issue of that railway company to the buyer of this title;
Contract of supply for mining - adds financial value of the routes linking the city of Lençois to another city;
Shipping company of the Velho Chico - only generates dividends;
Construction company - decreases the cost of construction on lands that have rivers and mountains, aand might enable the construction of one extra track in a round of operations.

Name: The Four Courts
Description: The Four Courts stumbled out of the gate (see the review "5 players enter the 4 Courts") and has been entirely rewritten. Progress and links to the new rules can be found in the thread "The Four Courts rebuilt" in the News section below.

Name: Cribball
Description:
Cribball is a sports action game for Cribbage players, involving the strategy of Cribbage and the competitive action of Football.

To play, all that is needed is a standard deck of playing cards and a basic knowledge of Cribbage.

The game played in two timed halves, of 30 or 60 minutes. Each player receives 3 time outs. The board is an illustrated football field, 50 yards in length, with an end-zone at each end of the field. Special deck cuts are used to determine kick-offs, kick returns, punts, field goals and extra point attempts. The players play a hand of Cribbage. The difference between the hand scores is the total net yardage gained or lost by the offensive player. The football peg is then moved the appropriate distance on the field. If the ball advances over the end-zone, the offensive player scores a touchdown. At the end of the regulation time, the player with the higher score is the victor.

From the rule book.

Name: Den Svenska Myllan
Description:
A Swedish historical trivia game. Translated from the homepage:

"Den Svenska Myllan is a historical quiz. It contains more than 7200 questions and answers.

Questions about the Swedes adventures from Antiquity to the Present. Sometimes you need to know about names and events, others times you use your logic.

Rules, game pieces, dice and dice points (money) are included. The playing field measuring 42x42 cm."

Name: Morpion Solitaire
Description:
A simple but deep solo game played with pen and grid paper.

Starting from an initial cross pattern of 36 marks, score one point for each mark you can add to the pattern that can be joined with existing marks into a non-overlapping line of five.

Name: Kannst du das ABC?
Description:
(Loosely translated from publisher's description)

Hooray! Alex Ape is happy, because he received a postcard from his friend Paul Penguin! Help them, and divide the postcards among the animals. Each card shows the first letter of one animal. Turn the card over to see whether you have given the postcard to the right animal!

Name: CEO: Cheat Every One
Description:
You are a "CEO" of a multinational company. Your objective is to "transfer" money from the company account to your private "retirement" account on the Cayman Islands. You fly around the game board in your company jet, carrying a well-stuffed moneybag - but the money isn’t yours.. yet. 
As a serious and highly paid "CEO" you have a lot of chores; hiring a new secretary, whose business qualifications spring from her weeklong experience as a Hooters waitress, convincing the SEC that a couple of late night phone calls do not qualify as insider trading, but are simply a question of friendly talk between collegues, and maintaining your expensive friendship with the local politicians. Of course you also have to be on top of the latest news from the various business' you are involved in, which means chatting up other "CEO's" on luxury cruises. On your way, you encounter the chance to do alittle trading, spend the Company's money on luxury items and maybe have a run-in with the IRS or the SEC. So before you get to fly to Cayman, your moneybag may have inflated or deflated – or you may even be forced to exchange your moneybag with another "CEO".

You are ready to retire (have won the game) when you have put away 150 Million on your private Cayman Islands account.

Name: Rattlesnake Creek
Description:
Howdy, ya'll. Rattlesnake Creek is a rip-roaring miniatures wargaming system primarily designed for 25/28mm models.

Set in the Old West, this game delivers a fast, simple, and exciting experience of small-scale gun battles, recreating the drama of combat with dice rolls and poker chips.

So grab yer six-shooter, pilgrim!

Name: Health
Description:
You start the game with 50% health. The object is to get to 100%, but the luring sides of life and the challenges are plentiful and you can easily fall into the pits that will give you lower health.

The Health game is a good mix of questions, brain trainers and - if you are up for it - physical exercises (can be played without if you choose)

There are two different categories of cards (questions and exercises) in the game:

F-cards contain questions about Food, Fitness & Family.

W-cards are challenges for your Will, Wit and Well-being. Some of these 'exercises' call for the use of the timer included in the game.

The more correctly you answer questions and solve your challenges, the healthier you become - at least in the game.

Name: History of War: Allied Expansion
Description:
The Allies expansion set is an expansion for the base-game History of War. It uses the same game mechanics but introduces new units into HoW. As always there is a solid mixture of base improvements, territory improvements, units and action cards. The Allies Expansion Set may not be played stand-alone.

From the back of the box: (including typos)
For the first time in card game history, fans of both card an strategy games will be able to experience a phenomenal and stunning new gaming experience.  Units that you are likely to encounter: Spitfires, p-38 Lightning, B-17's, German Ju-87 Stukas and Heinkel HE-111 bombers.  Thanks like the well known Sherman and the deadly Tiger.  Also the naval power does not stay behind and will be represented by powerful units like the German Super Battleship Tirpitz and the powerful British Dreadnoughts, while next to them invisible submarines roam the wide deep Atlantic trade routes...

Card mix: (55 cards)
14 x land units
15 x air units
11 x naval units
 5 x action cards
 3 x territory improvement
 5 x base improvement
 2 x territory

Name: History of War: Axis Expansion
Description:
The Axis expansion set is an expansion for the base-game History of War. It uses the same game mechanics but introduces new units into HoW. As always there is a solid mixture of base improvements, territory improvements, units and action cards.

The Axis Expansion Set may not be played stand-alone.

From the back of the box: (including typos)
For the first time in card game history, fans of both card an strategy games will be able to experience a phenomenal and stunning new gaming experience.  Units that you are likely to encounter: Spitfires, P-38 Lightning, B-17's, German Ju-87 Stukas and Heinkel HE-111 bombers.  Tanks like the well known Sherman and the deadly Tiger.  Also the naval power does not stay behind and will be represented by powerful units like the German Super Battleship Tirpitz and the powerful British Dreadnoughts, while next to them invisible submarines roam the wide deep Atlantic trade routes...

Card mix: (55 cards)
14 x land units
15 x air units
 4 x naval units
10 x action cards
 5 x territory improvement
 5 x base improvement
 2 x territory

Name: Defenders of the Realm: The Dragon Expansion
Description:
Defenders of the Realm: The Dragon Expansion provides the means to ramp up, ease up, expand and customize your Defenders of the Realm gaming experience in a variety of ways. The three new Dragon Generals (Onyx - black, Hemlock - green, Brimstone - red) can be used with Sapphire, the original blue Dragon, in a struggle that will severely test the mettle of the Heroes of the Realm. The new General card for Sapphire gives her an additional hit point for each other Dragon in play.

You can also mix and match the new Generals with the existing Generals. The new Generals minions' each have their own special abilities:

     Onyx's (black) Zealots go berserk when fighting - the survivors together dealing one point of damage after each combat action. You'll still take a wound from each if you remain in the same area with them at the end of your turn.
     Hemlock's (green) Imps propagate quickly (whenever you place an Imp, another one pops up in every adjacent space) and steal a random card from you if you remain in the same space with them at the end of your turn.
     Brimstone's (red) Fire Elementals spontaneously combust whenever three of them get together, setting the area on fire. Areas on fire require 2 Actions to move into, taint whenever three minions are present, instead of 4 and deal wounds to Heroes remaining in the area at the end of their turns.


The Generals each have their own special nastiness as well. For example, Brimstone, instead of moving along the usual red-General path, moves every time her card comes up when Darkness Spreads, flitting here and there and setting the world on fire. Players can lose cards when attacking Hemlock.

Any of the new dragons can also be used as an Agent of the Dark Lord when playing with at least one of the original Generals (Varkolak, Gorgut, or Balazarg). You can add up to 5 of the 10 Global Effects Cards (5 Good, 5 Bad) to the Darkness Spreads deck to adjust the toughness of your campaign. Likewise, a number of Royal Blessing Tokens (4 max) can also be added to the game. Royal Blessings allow players to either ignore a Darkness Spreads card, remove a taint crystal or prevent a General from moving.

For a more Campaign-style game, players can utilize the King's Champion Scoring Variant which allows players to track their feats, major and minor. Feat examples include: taking on 3 minions at once, killing two with one blow, attempting to complete a quest, successfully completing a quest, healing the land, putting out a fire, dealing wounds or the killing blow to a General... The player with the most fame at the end of the game becomes the King's Champion. The 2nd, 3rd and 4th most famous Heroes also receive titles and awards. The titles and awards each provide a special ability to that character that can be utilized the next time it is played by the same player.

Scheduled to debut at Spiel 2010 is the Dragon Expansion (formerly the Black Dragon expansion), which consists of the following:

3 General Miniatures (3 Dragons) 
3 New General Cards
1 New Sapphire (Blue Dragon) General Card
4 Wound Tokens 1 for each General 
3 Agents of the Dark Lord Cards
10 Fire Tokens 
4 Royal Blessing Tokens
1 Royal Blessing Card 
12 New Quest Cards
10 Global Effects Cards 
1 Fame Card
6 New Special Cards 
New Darkness Spreads Deck
New Hero Cards Deck 
King’s Champion Variant Scoring Tokens 
7 Kings Champion Reward Cards
Rulebook and A Story from the Realm

Name: Three-Card Monte
Description:
Three-Card Monte is played one of two ways.  The first method is a children's game in which three cards or objects are laid out face-up.  The cards or objects are then turned face down and scrambled.  The challenge is then to pick out where one of the objects is now positioned.  It's flipped over and the guess is either correct or not.

Variations of this "honest" version are now commonly shown on the big screens of sporting events.

The "confidence" version of Three-Card Monte actually uses 4 cards.  The dealer uses a palming technique to make a card switch, so that the player can't find the correct card.  This method is a rigged game, which often involves the use of a shill to create the illusion the game can be won.

Name: Warcosm Assault (Supplemental Edition)
Description:
Expand your Warcosm games with boarding actions.

This add-on provides quick-playing rules for using assault squads. Board enemy vessels and either sabotage or commandeer them, but be ready to fight off defending contingent squads. Maintaining the same game mechanics as ship to ship battles, this addendum to the Warcosm game introduces new rules for assault craft, troops, hyper-shunting, and ramming, as well as new systems like assault bays, chaff launchers, plasma bursters, and tractor emitters.

Available in both PDF and printed formats.

Name: Masters of Europe
Description: The great powers of eary modern Europe strive for asendency.  Playing country, action, and number cards into various types of melds allows control of a nation, and a chance to industrialize it, through such occurences as war, marriage, alliances. Victory points are awarded for taking control through various means, whoever gets the most points wins.  In addition to a board with spaces for each of 15 countries, there is a custom card deck, and you'll need tokens/markers/chips: unique color for each player to show control, common set for victory points, common set of industry markers.

Name: Top Speed
Description:
This is not a driving school, ladies and gentlemen.

We know you can all change gears, accelerate, brake, turn, pass... But that is not all there is to it. This is racing. And you're the elite of the elite.

And racing is about taking risks. About knowing when and how much to risk.

The new Compact Edition replaces the first edition and it's fully compatible with it (same rules and decks). The base game is for 2 players. Then you can purchase additional decks for more players (you need one additional cotton case to keep those extra decks). In order to make things simpler, the base game contains all eight cars and counters.

The base game (2 players) contains: pad (circuit), 2 lap markers (gray), cotton case, 8 plastic cars, 8 plastic counters, 2 decks, one plastic 'safety car' (finally!), rulebook.

With the base game you can also play Top Speed Mini.

Name: The Across the U.S.A. Game
Description:
Get set for a great trip across the U.S.A.! You don't have to worry about what to bring or what to wear. So don't drag out the backpacks or knapsacks, and forget about the plane, train, and bus tickets. You won't even need a driver's license. All you will need for the journey is THE ACROSS THE USA GAME book and a few playful, game-loving friends.

With this great game you'll travel from coast to coast, exploring all fifty states and discovering all sorts of interesting info about this wonderful land of ours. You'll find out about national parks and rivers, famous monuments and landmarks, prominent people, state capitals, flowers, and birds - tons of terrific trivia. When your cross-country game is finished, you will have had a fun-filled time from sea to shining sea - and what better souvenir of an unforgettable trip!

- from inside cover

This game was sold as a slim staple-bound book. The map gameboard is on the center pages, with a list of basic facts about each US state on the backs of the gameboard pages. The surrounding pages contain a total of 32 punch-out trivia cards, each with 8 questions on the front and 8 answers on the back. The rules are inside the back cover. Players must provide their own playing pieces and a die.

- user description

Name: Hi-Ho! Cherry-O VCR Game
Description:
(from back of box)

Children will be charmed and challenged as they play this delightful counting game which combines live-action and animation.

-Puppet host Farmer Bing gives simple step-by-step directions, guiding children through three different picking sessions.  After setting up the game, little or no adult assistance is required.
-10 of Farmer Bing's animal friends star in fun-filled animated sequences featuring the Farmer's toe-tapping theme song.
-Every game is unique because random play elements assure that no two games will ever play exactly the same.
-There's educational as well as entertainment value as children pick cherries, and are then shown how to count them.

Name: Stockcar Challenge
Description:
From the box: The ultimate stock car racing trivia board game for race fans coast to coast.

Players answer stock car racing trivia questions to move off Pit Road, onto the Track and around to the Finish and Victory Lane.

Name: Baseball Heroes
Description:
Baseball Heroes is a two player baseball card game, designed by Luke Morris, that captures the psychological battle between pitcher and batter.

Three teams with 36 unique players line up to hit eachother out of the park! The pitching player and batting player try to psych-out eachother into striking out or throwing a bad pitch to be hammered away for a home run.

Baseball Heroes is a light game but includes rules for outfield and infield fielding, dropped catches, bunts, base stealing, double plays, errors, runs, balls, strikes, bullpens and more. Each batter has his strengths and weaknesses and each pitcher has his list of balls he can pitch.

Baseball Heroes is also available with full Japanese rules.

Name: Of Armies and Hordes
Description:
User Summary:

Of Armies and Hordes is a fantasy mass combat miniatures system from Ganesha Games, following in the footsteps of its successful fantasy skirmish miniatures system, Song of Blades and Heroes.  Of Armies and Hordes allows players to enact large-scale fantasy battles with 15mm or 25/28mm miniatures, with some similarities (such as Quality and Combat Ratings) to the skirmish rules.

Here is a link to a preview of the Army Builder.
Families: Series: Song of Blades and Heroes

Name: Railways of the Western U.S.
Description:
Railways of the Western U.S. is an expansion for Railways of the World. Designed by Rick Holzgrafe, this expansion map uses the score track, pieces, tiles, money, trains, bonds and rules of the original game, but comes with a new map, featuring the Western half of the United States. The basic mechanics and gameplay of the original game are unchanged, as players build track and deliver goods to increase their income and earn points, but the expansion also includes new pieces and rules. These extras may optionally be used with this expansion as well as with the base game and all other expansions.

This expansion is also compatible with Railroad Tycoon.

Name: Railways Through Time
Description:
Railways Through Time is an expansion for Railways of the World. It requires the pieces, tiles, money, trains, bonds, and rules of the original game, but comes with an innovative board that takes the Railways of the World family in a whole new direction by introducing a third dimension: time.

This rules of this new expansion follow the basic gameplay and pick-up and deliver mechanism of the Railways of the World series but introduce the idea of time travel between different eras.

A similar concept was released as an expansion for Age of Steam, called Age of Steam Expansion: Time Traveler.

Name: Reykjanesspilið
Description: A trivia game about the municipality of Reykjanesbær in Iceland. The questions come in three levels of difficulty making this an easier game for younger / less knowledgable players than many trivia games.

Name: Versuch eines aufs Schachspiel gebaueten taktischen Spiels von zwey und mehreren Personen zu spielen
Description:
An abstract wargame from 1780!

Also known as "Hellwigs Kriegsspiel" (Hellwigs Wargame) or "Braunschweiger Kriegsspiel" (Brunswick Wargame).

It's an attempt to recreate 18th century warfare through an chess-like approach.

Mainly it was made for military education and entertainment.
The main goal is to capture the enemy fortress.
Players have Infantry, Cavalry and Artillery to obtain their task.
One unit represents a battalion.
The movement of the pieces and combat is similar to chess.
The game is played on a board with 1617 squares depicting terrain like towns, marshes and rivers.

Name: Fantasy Chess
Description:
Fantasy Chess is a blend of Traditional Chess and miniatures or role-playing game mechanics where you can co-occupy squares and use dice to determine capture outcomes.

Develop new strategies and alter old ones as you experience familiar chess from a whole new angle.

Traditional King, Queen, Bishop, Knight, Rook, Pawn pieces that move and check the same as traditional chess, but may move through their own ranks, carry pieces, fight for squares (with dice and statistic sheet) and MORE!

Start off with the basic game that teaches how to co-occupy squares (you can have up to three of your own pieces in square) and how to fight for the square (attack the enemy piece using two six sided die against your own dexterity.  If you inflict damage, it lowers the enemy piece's life points.)  If several pieces are in a combat square, they all get an attack.  If it doesn't resolve in one swing each, then combat is continued in the next person's turn.  This means that you can send in re-inforcements.  Each piece class has different dexterity and hit points and some have armor.  All of this is listed on an easy to read stat sheet with bubbles to fill in for damage.

Check is handled in traditional style of check and checkmate.  But there are times when you can actually go head to head with the king in his square and check mate him.

The advanced game includes 4 more rules:

    Withdrawal (escaping from a combat square)
    Healing (Bishops and Queens can heal damaged pieces)
    Forced Retreat (Queens can kick other pieces out of her square)
    Carrying (Knights can carry a pawn or a bishop and Rooks can carry anything except another rook or the king)


In Advanced Tournament Games, winning pieces are declared veteran and they go up a rank either getting more hit points, do more damage or improve dexterity.

Fantasy Chess has the capacity for 4 player games.
Bump two Fantasy Chess boards next to each other and play ally with your partner with full use of both boards as you try to checkmate your opponents.

This can even be expanded into a 5+ player game by either bumping more boards together or having a Game Master who can run some home rule creature pieces as interference or aid to the two main players.  Try putting two rows of squares as a forest between the two boards.

A Chess game where your Knights can charge from Castles, Bishops can heal the injured, Six piece battles can be fought in a square, and you can bludgeon a King to death!

You can obtain Fantasy Chess® from the official website:  www.shadowhex.com or at [www.kickstarter.com/projects/869058411/fantasy-chess-a-fight-for-the-square-chess-variant] until 7 Nov 2011.

Name: Shields Up!
Description: A game of starship-based combat and exploration with a variable board of planets and empty space.  Mission, event, equipment and personnel cards are dealt to the planets, and players use their starcraft to travel amongst them, executing missions for the currency used to purchase upgrades to ship and crew, and to earn Fame points.  Game is won when a certain amount of Fame points are collected.

Name: Gasp!
Description:
Gasp! is a chaotic, extremely interactive trick-taking game for the Basic Decktet, a handful of its suited tokens and 2-5 players. Players are likely to gasp in astonishment as they watch their fortunes change with alarming frequency and rapidity.

One token in the reigning suit is awarded after each hand and the winner will be the first player to acquire 2 tokens in each of the Decktet’s 6 suits.

Name: Forest Wars of the Haven
Description:
"Forest Wars of the Haven" is a Fantasy themed board-wargame based on the novel The Haven (later revised as Forest Wars) by Graham Diamond, the co-designer. The game depicts an assault by the Forces of Man (also called the Forces of the Haven), consisting of humans, wolves, hawks, and eagles, on the camp of the Forest Lords, who control dogs and bats.

The gameplay will be familiar to anyone who has played a grand tactical wargame. The system is fairly standard for the period, with some special rules for air support, charging units, and units which can be hidden or have variable loyalty.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Traffic Jam Game
Description:
Traffic Jam - A zany gridlock game of limited strategy and outrageous bumping and blocking fun.
If you can avoid the patrolling policement and dodge your fellow drivers you have a chance of winning the game. It sounds easy... but players become ruthless as the intersection grows more more congested. One minuted you may be on the verge of winning and the next ... your card is bumped back to the start.
(Back of box)

Name: Carcassonne: La Porxada
Description:
La Porxada is a historical building in the town of Granollers. It was built in mid-16th century by order of the town council. At that time it was a cattle market and a place to trade agricultural commodities.

Carcassonne - La Porxada is a very-very-very little and semi-unofficial expansion for the game Carcassone (only 1 tile!); designed by Klaus-JÃ¼rgen Wrede and Oriol Comas i Coma.

It was available for those who took part in the National Carcassonne Tournament'2010 of Spain inside the Jugarxjugar'2010 Fair in Granollers city.
